  • Method Details

    • setCommandMacroManager

      public void setCommandMacroManager(CommandMacroManager cmm)

    • getCommandPreprocessor

      public ServersideCommandPreprocessor getCommandPreprocessor()

    • updateDaemonUID

      public void updateDaemonUID(int sessionId, String daemonUID)
      C2Interface implementations use this method to indicate that a new daemon is facilitating this commanding pathway.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The Id of the session to check for a command
      daemonUID - The new daemon's UID which will fulfill this command pathway roll

    • pollCommand

      public String pollCommand(int sessionId)
      C2Interface implementations use this method to query the next command to be sent to connected daemons. The C2Interface is responsible for determining what the applicable sessionId is prior to invocation
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The Id of the session to check for a command
      Returns:
      with a String containing the next command, or null if no commands are available

    • getDaemonUID

      public String getDaemonUID(int sessionId)
      C2Interface implementations use this method to query the current daemon UID associated with this session
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The Id of the session
      Returns:
      with a String containing the UID of the current daemon

    • determineAndGetCorrectSessionId

      public int determineAndGetCorrectSessionId(String hostname, String username, String protocol, String daemonUID)

    • updateSessionContactTime

      public void updateSessionContactTime(int sessionId)
      C2Interface implementations use this method notify that a session has had a successful contact attempt
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The Id of the session

    • sendCommand

      public void sendCommand(int sessionId, String command)
      TheAllCommander and implementations of AbstractCommandMacro use this method to place a command in the queue for transmission to a client
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The Id of the session
      command - The command to be sent

    • pollIO

      public String pollIO(int sessionId)
      TheAllCommander and AbstractCommandMacro implementations use these method to query for responses received from a client. The general concept is that sendCommand is invoked, and then pollIO is checked to see if a response has been received. The call is non-blocking, and the AbstractCommandMacro is free to wait as long or little as necessary before inferring silence as an outcome.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The Id of the session to check for a response
      Returns:
      with a String containing the next IO, or null if no commands are available

    • sendIO

      public void sendIO(int sessionId, String response)
      C2Interface implementations use this method to send a response back to the commanding session. The C2Interface is responsible for determining what the applicable sessionId is prior to invocation
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The Id of the session to check for a command
      response - the response message to be sent

    • getSessions

      public Set<Session> getSessions()

    • addSession

      public int addSession(String username, String hostname, String protocol, String daemonUID)
      C2Interface implementations use this method to add a new session and retrieve a session ID that can be used for further communication with the class. This method should only be used if there is not a prior session established with the same username, protocol, and hostname.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the connecting session
      hostname - The hostname of the connecting session
      protocol - The protocol of the connecting session
      daemonUID - The UID presented by the daemon
      Returns:
      an int representing the registered session ID.

    • addSession

      public int addSession(String username, String hostname, String protocol)
      C2Interface implementations use this method to add a new session and retrieve a session ID that can be used for further communication with the class.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the connecting session
      hostname - The hostname of the connecting session
      protocol - The protocol of the connecting session
      Returns:
      an int representing the registered session ID.

    • getSessionId

      public Integer getSessionId(String uid)

    • getSession

      public Session getSession(int id)

    • removeSession

      public void removeSession(int sessionId)
      C2Interface implementations can use this method to de-register a session ID if a client will not be connecting again under the same session
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The sessionID to remove

    • readAllMultilineCommands

      public String readAllMultilineCommands(int sessionId)
      Command macro implementations can use this method to return all IO that has been sent from the connected client in a single String
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The sessionID to query
      Returns:
      The assembled sum of all return IO.

    • awaitMultilineCommands

      public String awaitMultilineCommands(int sessionId, int extendedWait)
      Command macro implementations can use this method wait up extended wait interval for input from the client
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The sessionID to query
      extendedWait - The sessionID to query
      Returns:
      The assembled sum of all return IO.

    • awaitMultilineCommands

      public String awaitMultilineCommands(int sessionId)
      Command macro implementations can use this method wait up to the configurable Max Response Wait interval for input from the client
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The sessionID to query
      Returns:
      The assembled sum of all return IO.

    • forwardTCPTraffic

      public void forwardTCPTraffic(int sessionId, String forwardUrl, String base64Forward)
      This method is used by the user interface front end to queue traffic for transmission to the remote host for forwarding to the remote socket.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The sessionID to to send traffic
      forwardUrl - The ip:port to which the base64Forward data should be sent
      base64Forward - The traffic received from the local port, to be forwarded to the remote host
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - in response to invalid sessionId

    • availableForwards

      public Set<String> availableForwards(int sessionId)
      This method returns a set of all address:port forwards allocated to a session
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The sessionID check for available forwards
      Returns:
      the set of available forward addresses
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - in response to invalid sessionId

    • grabForwardedTCPTraffic

      public String grabForwardedTCPTraffic(int sessionId, String forwardUrl)
      This method is used by C2Interface implementations to pull forwarded TCP traffic which has been queued for transmission and forward it.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The sessionID to to receive traffic
      forwardUrl - The ip:port to which the base64Forward data should be sent
      Returns:
      Base64 encoded information to be send to the remote client for forwarding
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - in response to invalid sessionId

    • receiveForwardedTCPTraffic

      public String receiveForwardedTCPTraffic(int sessionId, String forwardUrl)
      This method is used by the user interface front end to pull traffic which has been received from the remote port forward and sends it on to the client.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The sessionID to to receive traffic
      forwardUrl - The ip:port to which the base64Forward data should be sent
      Returns:
      Base64 encoded information to be send to the local forwarded port
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - in response to invalid sessionId

    • queueForwardedTCPTraffic

      public void queueForwardedTCPTraffic(int sessionId, String forwardUrl, String base64Forward)
      This method is used by C2Interface implementations to queue forwarded traffic received from the remote port forward daemon for transmission to the local forward port.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The sessionID to to receive traffic
      forwardUrl - The ip:port to which the base64Forward data should be sent
      base64Forward - encoded information to be send to the local client for forwarding
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - in response to invalid sessionId
